definition: to trust one another fully/to treat sb with sincerity

sentences.english: His latest biographer, Mr. More, has been more candid.
sentences.chinese: 他最近的傳記作者，莫爾先生則較爲坦誠一些。

sentences.english: think innocently and justly, and, if you speak, speak accordingly.
sentences.chinese: 坦誠和公正的思考，並且，當你說話時也要這樣。

sentences.english: My life is very simple low-key man Frank Gao Biao in real good.
sentences.chinese: 我的生存法很簡單高標處世低調做人坦誠真實多好啊。

sentences.english: To me, it was just a matter of being candid with the resident natives.
sentences.chinese: 對於我來說，只需與當地居民坦誠相待即可。

sentences.english: History of the total, why is it so hard for me frank point?
sentences.chinese: 史總，爲什麼對我坦誠點這麼難？

sentences.english: “Like friends, we discuss those differences honestly and forthrightly,” Clinton said at the opening session yesterday of the first day of meetings between U.
sentences.chinese: 我們像朋友一樣坦誠直率地探討彼此間存在的差異。

sentences.english: Don't expect new acquaintances to be completely honest about themselves.
sentences.chinese: 不要期望認識不久的人會坦誠相見。

sentences.english: I am lively and cheerful, easy-going and generous, others frankly.
sentences.chinese: 我性格活潑開朗，隨和大方，待人坦誠。

sentences.english: To be honest, I am a diligent and outstanding student.
sentences.chinese: 可以坦誠的說，我是一名勤奮好學的優秀學生。

sentences.english: In 1866 Annie met the Rev. Frank Besant.
sentences.chinese: 在1866年會見了安妮牧師坦誠貝贊特。

sentences.english: So long as both sides treat each other sincerely, their ties will become even closer.
sentences.chinese: 只要雙方坦誠相待，我們的關係會更加密切。

sentences.english: You must be frank; but without indiscretion; and close, without being costive.
sentences.chinese: 你必須坦誠而不輕率，掌握分寸而不吝嗇小氣。

sentences.english: But I will always be honest with you about the challenges we face.
sentences.chinese: 但關於面對的挑戰，我會始終對你們坦誠相告。

sentences.english: I want to confess as best I can, but my heart is void.
sentences.chinese: 我想要盡我所能地坦誠，然而我的心卻空無所有。

definition: to take responsibility/to bear responsibility/to be responsible
to join/to connect/to link up/to communicate
to be in contact (with sb)/to associate/to interact/to get along (well, poorly)
counterpart/other person involved/opposite side/other side/receiving party
variant of 給予|给予[ji3 yu3]
